paragraph.materialsCitation:
Genetic data. BIN : BOLD :AAH8490 (n=10 from Ethiopia ; maximum variation 0.8%); nearest species:
Z. melpomene
(3.4%). One other specimen of
Z. excavata
from Ethiopia (BC ZSM Lep 14827) clustering with the West African BIN ( BOLD :AAH8466; n=16 from Cameroon , Guinea , Sao Tomé and Principe , Angola ) of the nominotypical subspecies and diverging by 4.6 % from the Ethiopian BIN of
subsp. pollex
, probably due to genetic introgression.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution. Angola , Cameroon , Central African Republic , Democratic Republic of the Congo , Ethiopia , Guinea , Kenya , Madagascar , Malawi , Nigeria , Sierra Leone , Tanzania , Uganda , Zambia ( Fletcher 1974 ; De Prins & De Prins 2019 ). New for Sao Tomé and Principe . The subspecies
Z. excavata pollex
is endemic to Ethiopia .

Remarks. In male genitalia, the aedeagus is characteristic for the subspecies pollex , distinguished by the short length of the acicular projection arising from two-thirds aedeagus ( Fletcher 1974 ); apex of valva variable.
